analysis.description:
BitrngDice.sendFunds (/unique_chucks/4/0x047a68fc8aaa9109346c726c696986f4b5792658.sol#402-412) sends eth to arbitrary user
	Dangerous calls:
	- beneficiary.send(amount) (/unique_chucks/4/0x047a68fc8aaa9109346c726c696986f4b5792658.sol#405-412)
possibleWinAmount in BitrngDice._lockOrUnlockAmount (/unique_chucks/4/0x047a68fc8aaa9109346c726c696986f4b5792658.sol#545-546) is a local variable never initialiazed

Detected issues with version pragma in /unique_chucks/4/0x047a68fc8aaa9109346c726c696986f4b5792658.sol:
	- pragma solidity^0.4.17 (/unique_chucks/4/0x047a68fc8aaa9109346c726c696986f4b5792658.sol#1): it allows old versions
Parameter '_nextOwner' of BitrngDice.approveNextOwner (/unique_chucks/4/0x047a68fc8aaa9109346c726c696986f4b5792658.sol#683) is not in mixedCase
Parameter '_enabled' of BitrngDice.enable (/unique_chucks/4/0x047a68fc8aaa9109346c726c696986f4b5792658.sol) is not in mixedCase
